paragraph: It is disliked by those individuals who have prided themselves upon their superiority and the distinction between their reactions and motives and those of ordinary mankind. In other words, they attempt to become personalities through elevating themselves and lowering others, and it is a distinct blow to discover that beneath these pretensions lie the very ordinary elements shared in common by all. On the other hand, to those who have been able to recognize their own weaknesses and have suffered in the privacy of their own souls, the knowledge that these things have not set them apart from others, but that they are the common property of all and that no one can point the finger of scorn at his fellow, is one of the greatest experiences of life and is productive of the greatest relief.
question: What is the emotional experience for someone who has come to recognize that their personal struggles are not distinctive and are shared by others?
answer: For someone who has come to recognize that their personal struggles are not distinctive and are shared by others, the emotional experience is one of great relief and comfort. This realization helps to dispel feelings of isolation and shame, allowing them to see that they are not alone in their experiences. It fosters a sense of connection and understanding with others, making life more meaningful and less isolating.
